image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man accused of a stabbing attack on his mother has been formally charged with attempted murder in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Teen charged after allegedly stabbing mother 'multiple times'

image.altText: Canberra's coat of arms

props.synopsis: The Jumbunna review recommends "priority" systemic racism reviews of ACT Policing and Canberra's jail, and an inquiry into recent deaths in custody.

title.children: 'Police target your name': Scathing review of ACT Indigenous incarceration

image.altText: Canberra Symphony Orchestra

props.synopsis: The Canberra Symphony Orchestra writes directly to the ANU's leadership about proposed changes that would see traditional one-to-one instrument lessons discontinued.

title.children: Prominent orchestra makes pitch to save ANU School of Music from cuts

image.altText: A grass strip next to a road with multiple bouquets of flowers and a wooden cross.

props.synopsis: A man sentenced over his part in a fatal crash in Canberra in April last year has been urged to use his time jail to get "as straight as possible".

title.children: Canberra man jailed for role in crash that killed 15yo passenger

image.altText: An anonymous schoolgirl walks down a corridor, away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Fewer than one in five public schools in the ACT are expected to meet budget this year, and now union representatives say classes are being merged and teachers cancelled to deal with the deficit.

title.children: Classes combined, teachers cancelled amid public schools' budget woes

image.altText: A man reads a government prohibition notice on the exterior of a bakers delight that says "closed" in large red letters.

props.synopsis: Regulators issue a prohibition order to shut down a food business when there's an imminent threat to public health. So why have so many been issued?

title.children: Forced closures of Canberra food venues jump by almost 400pc

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Rick McGary, who has been on trial three times for rape, is now behind bars after a jury found him guilty of two charges against two women.

title.children: Former Canberra academic found guilty of raping two women

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe pleads guilty to the stabbing murder of Tshewang Choden at the National Zoo and Aquarium in December 2023.

title.children: 'Prettiest name in the world': Man's text to co-worker before her murder

image.altText: Joseph stands holding a wire fence near his cafe, outside in Garema Place. He wears a black winter coat and blue jumper.

props.synopsis: A gazebo in the heart of the CBD is at the centre of a row between the government and a hospitality venue owner. He says it's already cost him $150,000.

title.children: Restaurateur rips down $150k gazebo, claims government U-turn

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit with purple tie sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: Australia now has some cover to follow the UK and France on a Palestinian state without fearing a backlash from the US.

title.children: Keir Starmer paves the way for Anthony Albanese on Palestinian state

image.altText: Two women wearing University graduation gowns and mortar boards.

props.synopsis: Australians with student debts will have their HECS cut by 20 per cent after the government's bill passed the Senate. Follow live.

title.children: Bill to cut Australians' HECS debts by 20 per cent passes parliament

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Burke confirms he had dinner with FBI director
The final Question Time of the sitting week is about to start!
FBI director Kash Patel makes secretive visit to Australia

image.altText: A man pictured smiling at the altar on his wedding day.

props.synopsis: Father of two Brian Dean died of sepsis about 24 hours after he was discharged from a Geelong hospital. His family and their lawyer want a coroner to examine whether the death was preventable.

title.children: Brian was discharged from hospital. He died from sepsis the next day

image.altText: Two students hold dusters to erase crosses on a board

props.synopsis: After 17 years of NAPLAN testing, Australia is yet to see a big turnaround in results — so what can be done to improve them?

title.children: 'Postcode, privilege' — not education system — shaping 'opportunity'

image.altText: A woman walking past a TV screen showing a tsunami evacuation notice.

props.synopsis: The East Asian country, sitting on one of the most geologically active parts of the world, is no stranger to the threat of tsunamis. That became clear as its 121 million people responded to Wednesday's threat.

title.children: How Japan was so well-prepared for the Russian tsunami threat

image.altText: Man in suit wearing headset faces screen showing Jerome Powell

props.synopsis: The US president says the August 1 deadline for imposing higher "reciprocal" tariffs stands. Local stocks are poised to follow Wall Street lower after the US central bank left interest rates on hold. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Stocks fall as US rate cut hopes dashed and tariff deadline looms

image.altText: Silhouettes of four people are seen in front of a purple background and a set of scales of justice

props.synopsis: One year since governments responded to the disability royal commission, those who poured their heart into it are wondering what has come of their efforts.

title.children: $600m, 4.5 years, 222 recommendations and little to show for it so far

image.altText: A dark van with a stripe on the bottom and a roof rack in dirt around bushland.

props.synopsis: After Carolina Wilga's miracle survival in West Australian bush, local farmers have worked together and braved rough terrain to recover her abandoned van.

title.children: Volunteers recover German backpacker's abandoned vehicle

image.altText: Laura Dahlmeier skiing in a biathlon event with mountains behind her.

props.synopsis: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier has died, aged 31, after being hit by a rockfall while climbing in the mountains of Pakistan.

title.children: Olympic gold medallist dies in mountain climbing accident

image.altText: A small wood heater with fire wood

props.synopsis: A new generation of low-emission wood heaters that produce a fraction of the particulate pollution of current models could save lives by improving air quality, researchers say.

title.children: Why Australia hasn't adopted NZ's solution to wood smoke pollution

image.altText: A woman with a baby on her back with a rifle hanging on the wall in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans are being encouraged to have more children by the likes of Donald Trump, JD Vance and Elon Musk. And even though the risks for the poster families of pronatalism are real they are happy to bear them.

title.children: 'A worthwhile way to die': Inside America's pronatalist movement

image.altText: A woman in a pool swimming the freestyle stroke.

props.synopsis: An Australian race in 1901 helped bring the freestyle stroke to the world.

title.children: The forgotten swimmer who helped bring freestyle to the world

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe Message Stick

props.synopsis: Independent senator Lidia Thorpe has warned Australia is at risk of "losing another generation" of First Nations people to the criminal justice system without urgent action from all levels of government.

title.children: 'Dismally failing’: State and territory funding cuts urged for Gap failures

image.altText: Mollie O'Callaghan smiles with her gold medal after winning the women's 200m freestyle at the world swimming championships.

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan equals Grant Hackett with her 10th world championship gold, as Kyle Chalmers looks ominous.

title.children: O'Callaghan equals Aussie swimming legend with gold at world champs

image.altText: A woman standing infront of a light house

props.synopsis: Zali Steggall warns that the costs of climate change must be a focus at the government's productivity roundtable, with the issue already costing billions. She says a levy on fossil fuel exports could help fund climate disaster prevention.

title.children: Tax fossil fuel exports or risk losing revenue to other nations, says Steggall

image.altText: A rocket taking off

props.synopsis: Gilmour Space's orbital rocket Eris came down quickly after an engine failure this week, but the Australian company behind the attempt is undeterred.

title.children: Aussie rocket launch deemed a success despite crash after 14 seconds

image.altText: A glider resting on the ground.

props.synopsis: A man has died in a glider crash on Queensland's Darling Downs, the second fatal aviation crash in the region in the less than two weeks.

title.children: Pilot dies in second aviation crash on the Darling Downs within two weeks

image.altText: A medium shot of a sign reading: Emergency

props.synopsis: In WA each day, an average of 200 people who have been assessed as appropriate for residential aged care or at-home support remain in hospital beds due to a shortage of places.

title.children: Hundreds of WA hospital beds occupied by people who don't need to be there

image.altText: People stand by the side of the road dressed in Black Sabbath tshirts.

props.synopsis: Fans of Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne lined the streets of Birmingham in the UK to pay tribute to the late musician, while his wife Sharon was moved to tears as she laid flowers for her husband.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne fans line Birmingham streets to pay tribute ahead of funeral

image.altText: England bowler Ben Stokes puts his hand behind his back while leaning forward during a Test match.

props.synopsis: England captain Ben Stokes should be fit for the Ashes in Australia despite succumbing to a shoulder injury before the final Test of the current series against India.

title.children: Ben Stokes still on track for Ashes despite succumbing to another injury

image.altText: A police car at night

props.synopsis: A man shot dead by police in regional Victoria was attacking his sister when officers arrived, authorities say.

title.children: Man shot dead by police was attacking his sister, authorities say

image.altText: Police escort a man in a hoodie towards a car.

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police say they also seized cash and items alleged to be the proceeds of crime.

title.children: Men to face court after seizure of $1m worth of cocaine

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has been barred from selling the home in which she served her relatives a deadly beef Wellington meal so it may be used in future compensation claims by her victims or their families.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson barred from selling Leongatha home

image.altText: A composite image featuring seven book covers on an angle on a pink background

props.synopsis: This month's best new releases shine a light on growing up queer in a small town, the social inequity of the US college system, and dealing with the double whammy of an unfaithful husband and a cancer diagnosis.

title.children: 'Rip-your-hair-out brilliant': July's best new books

image.altText: A man in a blue and red shirt and jacket holding a lobster in a white room.

props.synopsis: The harmful algal bloom is already impacting the fishing industry, with producers asking customers to keep buying to avoid piling on pain.

title.children: SA fishers urge people to keep buying seafood amid algal bloom

image.altText: Aerial view of Mount Isa mine site.

props.synopsis: The ground in Mount Isa usually shakes twice a day with mine blasts, but today silence signals the end of era.

title.children: One of Australia's largest copper mines closes after 70 years
